page.title: 04Farming(1)
page.content: The area we are covering for our Domesday Project covers a part of Herefordshire long famous for the quality of its agricultural land. To the west the land is rising gently to Eccleswall then falls to a valley which runs from north to south. In the valley floor the fields are large and suitable for growing crops. The land then rises again more sharply to Linton Ridge where the fields become smaller and more suitable for keeping animals. There are many farms marked on our maps but many of them are no longer working farms.Hownhall for example used to be a fruit farm but has sold most of its land,to local farmers and to a cider factory.Its barns have been sold for development and its present owners have kept two and a half acres and run it as a bed and breakfast.
